page.title: 12RIDING STABLES
page.content: The lady who runs the riding stables is called Mrs Lee.We went and interviewed her. We asked her some questions about the riding stables and the horses and ponies they have there. The riding stables are called the West Dorset Equestrian Centre. They have 18 horses and ponies, 8 stables and they have about 10 mares and the rest are geldings.They have to clean the tack every time used.They have 2 rallies, 1 for novices and 1 for seniors. They make their own hay and straw. They go to about 10 shows or more. To keep healthy they worm the horses and ponies every 6 weeks. In the winter the ponies are kept out and are ridden every weekend for about an hour and a half. The hunters are kept inside and are ridden every day for hour & half. The blacksmith is P&W. They charge Â£5.00 a lesson & Â£4.00 a ride.
